titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Carter, William Carter, and Henry Carter, Indictment
CWG7593

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
John Carter. Wm Carter Henry Carter

"The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Carter Wm Carter & Henry Carter of the crime of Horse Stealing as follows Viz The said John Carter Wm Carter & Henry Carter did on the 1st day of May 1865 in the County aforesaid feloniously take and carry away three horses of the value of One hundred Dollars each the personal property of Jack Mason against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
N Grief
F. W. Sayre
H. C. Pitt
J P Mason
L. G. Mason
Frank Sayer and wife } Graves County

Endorsed, A true bill
J. G. Cole
Foreman
Bail is fixed on this indictment at Four hundred Dollars for each Deft --

A Copy
Attest
B Small clrk
By Henry C. Yeiser D C

Coml
vs } Horse Stealing
Jno. Carter & others
